intro: Leucostegia assamica, commonly known as the Assam sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, delicate white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leucostegia assamica is often found in rocky or alpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
